summary: An FBI Special Agent expresses confusion and disappointment to SDNY leadership over the decision to remove a lead prosecutor from the Epstein case, praising the prosecutor's work and leadership over two years and questioning the fairness of the decision.

persons.name: SSA - Squad C-20 Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking FBI New York
persons.context: Author of the correspondence expressing disappointment to SDNY about the removal of a lead prosecutor from the Epstein case.

events.title: Decision to Remove Lead Prosecutor
events.description: SDNY made a decision to remove a lead prosecutor from the Epstein case, prompting a complaint from an FBI agent.
personsInvolved: SSA - Squad C-20 Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking FBI New York

keyFacts: An FBI Special Agent wrote to SDNY leadership expressing confusion and disappointment over the removal of a lead prosecutor from the Epstein case.
The removed prosecutor had been the leader of the prosecution team for two years, participating in dozens of interviews and extensive case work.
The agent believes the decision is unfair to the prosecutor and to the prosecution team who must now onboard a new prosecutor.
The correspondence emphasizes the FBI's continued partnership with SDNY regardless of the prosecutor assignment.
The document reveals internal dissent and concern over prosecutorial decisions in the high-profile Epstein case.
